results.title: Reflections: Ireland
results.creator_credit: Viscom Productions, Grania O'Shannon, John Spencer and Patrick Carey
results.brief_description: This beautiful atmospheric film shows various aspects of an Irish landscape, which is particularly emphasised by rivers, wind and sea. Interesting use of sounds, eg birds chirping, water flowing and the use of traditional Irish folk music played by Paddy Moloney and the Chieftains.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Viscom Productions, Grania O’Shannon, John Spencer and Patrick Carey

results.title: Reflections: a Japanese folk tale
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: In a tale designed to probe the many facets of perception, a young man buys a box with a mirrored bottom and sees in it the face of his dead father. On opening the box his wife sees a young rival and a holy woman sees another holy woman. Are our own perceptions distorted by self-images? Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Reflections on time
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Giancarlo Lui
results.brief_description: Introduces small and large units of time, and suggests that perhaps time is motion or life. The second part stresses the fact that we measure time by motion and vice-versa, gicing examples of various clocks. The third part illustrates the vastness of time using the Grand Canyon and the Galaxy of Andromeda.

results.title: Reflections of the Czech Republic
results.creator_credit: Czech Tourist Authority and Karel Zauld
results.brief_description: Set to a musical track and featuring no dialogue, this short film from the Czech Tourist Authority presents a montage of images depicting people at work and play in the Czech Republic; the culture, music, arts, natural wonders and traditional ceremonies of the area, creating a visual postcard of the region.

results.title: Reflections of modern Chinese culture in Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Kwang Hwa Mass Communications and Jason C. Hu
results.brief_description: Modern Chinese culture in all its vitality, springs from the glories of traditional Chinese culture dating back thousands of years. Ten compelling aspects of Chinese culture are highlighted including contemporary architecture, ancient Nankuan music, native choral singing, Buddhist religious education, opera, modern dance and ancestor-worship rituals. The ROC on Taiwan has managed to translocate its rich cultural heritage, so that it continues to flourish.

results.title: Reflecting on the moon
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, Lothar Wolff Productions and Lothar Wolff
results.brief_description: Explains why the moon’s surface is pitted and notes the conditions there that make it unsuitable for human habitation. Notes the cycle of the moon in relation to the earth, and introduces the concept of gravity through footage of the 1969 American landing. Suitable for upper primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Geographic Society, Lothar Wolff Productions and Lothar Wolff

results.title: Refinishing furniture
results.brief_description: Bob Flexner provides a working knowledge of the practical and decorative aspects of refinishing furniture, indicating when to rejuvenate an old finish, how to remove a finish that has failed and how to refurnish fine furniture. This informative video covers ‘Reviving furniture’, ‘Stripping’, ‘Sealing and filling’, ‘Glazing’, ‘Finishing with oil, varnish, shellac and lacquer’ and how to ‘Adjust and repair finishes’.

results.title: Reefer madness
results.creator_credit: Motion Picture Ventures, Inc, G and H Production, George A. Hirliman and Louis Gasnier
results.brief_description: During the 1930’s, one of the favourite subjects of ‘poverty row’ exploitation low budget “Warning!” films was the evils of “the devil’s weed” - marijuana. Pure campy melodrama and completely hilarious by current standards, these films were considered tight drama under the guise of warning the audience of how one puff of pot can destroy young lives and lead clean-cut teenagers down the road of insanity and death. The plot of “Reefer Madness” is no different, with a young man’s life becoming a nightmare with Miles’ frenzied piano solo a highlight of the film. Originally titled “The Burning Question” and then “Tell Your Children.” Starring Dorothy Short, Kenneth Craig, Lillian Miles, Dave O’Brien, Thelma White and Carleton Young.

results.title: Reedy river
results.creator_credit: Peter Hamilton Productions, Peter Hamilton, Keith Gow and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Lawson’s poem is dramatised and set to music in a pastoral setting. Describes the hardships and joys of settling in virgin country, and for the settler, the greatest hardship of all, the loss of his beautiful wife. Uses flashback technique. Enacted by Jock Levy and Sylvia Salisbury while the words are sung by Alex Hood, Barbara Lysiak and the Ramblers.

results.title: Rediscovery: art media - paper mache
results.brief_description: Presents the basic process involved in sculpting and creating 3-D forms using paper mache - one of the cheapest and easiest ways of creating objects. Jewelry, toy houses, elephants, birds etc - from paper strips to paper mulch students develop their own creative ideas. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
